intro: Cypella herbertii var. ramosa, commonly known as the Herbert's cypella, is a flowering plant native to the south-western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. The leaves are finely divided and often have a peppery scent when crushed.
